newsitem.title: USA: Navarre says completes Netradio deal.
newsitem.headline: Navarre says completes Netradio deal.

text.p: Navarre Corp said it completed its acquisition of the remaining 50-percent of NetRadio Corp, owner of an Internet entertainment site.
Under the terms of the deal, the distributor of music, computer software and interactive CD-ROM products said it issued 125,000 shares of Navarre common stock to NetRadio shareholders.
Navarre Corporation acquired an initial 50-percent ownership of NetRadio in May 1996 for $1.5 million.
"Based on the financial performance of NetRadio through February 1999, NetRadio shareholders could receive up to an additional 1.97 million shares of Navarre Corp common stock," the company said.
Concurrent with Navarre's purchase, ValueVision International Inc acquired a 15-percent interest in Navarre's NetRadio subsidiary for about $3 million in cash and other services, Navarre said.
ValueVision is an electronic and print media direct marketing company and runs the nation's third-largest television home-shopping network.
